text: I considered that, but the design is pretty custom and was looking for more customizing options.

I have created a custom form as the client requested an unusual layout not possible with the firm builder.... and used fields I have created in HubSpot form builder. The mark up works and submissions through it are received OK. But tracking does not work. Emails are not sent. And the form does not display a message after submisson. Is it even possible to set up a form thjis way?
When you say “tracking doesn’t work” can you elaborate on what you mean by that? Do page views on populate on the Contact record?  Do you have a page this is on I could take a look at?  <@UFZ869C9W>
@zack - this is the form <http://landing.edgescan.com/partnership>

29
ALL TIME VIEWS
2
SUBMISSIONS TO DATE
6.9%
CONVERSION RATE
These dont change after I view the form or submit but the submissions come through
quick question.. has anyone implemented Google Translate onto a HubSpot page? if yes, do it properly translate CTAs?
Do you mind if I put a submission through?
sure
you dont need to fill all fields in BTW (its a really bad form IMO)
copy that

I haven't done it myself, but I doubt it would work since CTAs are loaded after the initial pageload via JS. Additionally, unlike forms, I don't think there's a way to run an additional function after the CTA loads (which could be used to query a translation API or something).
so when I look at the information in the hidden field `hs_context` the infromation looks off.  The `pageUrl` is the preview version of the page. I also don’t see a `hutk` key in the JSON
How did you get the embed code for this?
<@U7BQUDTEJ> another translation option is <https://www.HubSpot.com/integrations/agency-service-primers/translate>

I created a basic version with fields set up, inspected, pasted the code and copied the code, pasted into a new module and added rows and columns etc in between the fields - I could not see any other way to do it with the required layout

gotcha, I think the Forms API might be the best way to go for you.  The embed code fills in `hs_context` in a way that allows us to calculate the metrics you are referring to (among other things).  This way you can create a form element that looks like exactly like you want and then tell HubSpot about the form submission via this endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>
The downside is you won’t be managing the fields in the HubSpot UI, but given HS isn’t controlling the layout, that seems OK from what I can see
Ok thanks a lot Zack for your help. I will check this out I was not aware of it
Yeah, of course, let me know if you have any questions

This is a Google Webmaster Tools with HubSpot question, so my main domain is a redirect (i.e. <http://www.domain.com|www.domain.com>), I am using a directory for main page (i.e. <http://www.domain.com/home|www.domain.com/home>), I am able to verify my /home with google webmaster tools but how do I crawl the main domain to hit other pages that live under the main domain (i.e. <http://www.domain.com/subpage|www.domain.com/subpage>)

<@UF6M5BW4C> HubSpot automatically has a sitemap.xml file
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/view-and-edit-your-HubSpot-hosted-domain-sitemap>

Well I wanted to recrawl my sitemap, but I cannot trigger that on just the main domain, is there a wa to push for google to recrawl if I have a robot.txt change? I am finding that a Gated PDF in filemanager is showing up, so I am trying to exclude that from search results

<@U7SL518D6> so my sitemap still lives under <http://mydomain.com/sitemap|mydomain.com/sitemap>, but I can only verify my homepage using <http://mydomain.com/home|mydomain.com/home>, so when it asks for what the sitemap is the text field allows me to type-in but only after <http://mydomain.com/home/[Enter|mydomain.com/home/[Enter> sitemap URL], do you see my dilemma? so I would I crawl the <http://mydomain.com|mydomain.com> domain since it is a redirect

I’m not sure how to help in this case it seems like you accidentally entered your domain into google web master tools with the /home in the URL. and if that’s the case you need to resubmit the site as if it’s a whole new site.

I did not accidentally enter the domain in wrong, we are redirect the main domain but using /home as our main page, and other pages live under the main domain as well, so basically there is no way to verify the main domain since it is a redirect, there is no actual page to put the code on
I have the <http://mydomain.com|mydomain.com> as a property but I cannot actually verify it with head code cause it is not a page, it redirects
I understand now. afraid I’ve got no clue how to solve that one. You could temporarily move the /home to be at the root confirm the domain in webmaster tools then move it back?
each time I try to very the <http://mydomain.com|mydomain.com> adding in all the different code elements I get the same:
you might be able to verify via google analytics if you have that set up
they give you like 5 ways to verify ownership
tried that as well, I have it in the Settings of the root domain but still get the failed authentication:
I think it is cause it is a redirect as the root domain, no code generates at all
<@U7SL518D6>, you do not think there is a way to do it with the .html file, right, that google offers, because we do not have access to the HubSpot servers directly to drop that in

you cannot use the html file method because of where it wants that file to be placed.
all files in the file manager show at /hubfs/
I’d maybe contact HubSpot support maybe they’ve seen clients with a similar issue
purely out of curiosity, why don’t you want the homepage at the root domain instead of /home?

it was a Marketing request, the main domain is redirecting to a splash/landing page temporarily, not sure when it will be coming down but wanted to recrawl all pages under the domain because I updated the robot.txt and seems like google is still indexing pages that I specifically have to exclude
ahhh I see
why can’t you put the ownership tag at the splash/landing page

cause the main domain is a redirect going to a different domain, I have tagged the Settings in HubSpot on <http://mydomain.com|mydomain.com> but it is still not verifing so I am thinking it has to do with that the main domain, <http://mydoman.com|mydoman.com>, is a redirect while all the other pages under that domain, are not, so I can verify all the subpages, but not the <http://mydomain.com|mydomain.com>
yea, that sounds like an SEO mess. I’d have maybe just used a javascript redirect or overlayed the splash page over the real homepage.

yeah was thinking that as well, have a like a blank page for the <http://mydomain.com|mydomain.com> which has JS redirect that goes to the other domain, that way the site can be verified, maybe my only option
and just drop the redirect on the root domain
Question, not that it should even be done but... wondering if we can auto populate a "from name" and "subject line" at a template level in HubSpot email templates?
don’t think so but you can probably GRAB the from name and subject line that was set and display it inside the email. The only place to define what they should be is in the email’s settings.
I don't see any options for smart content - I have a form and I would like to use a different version for mobile - Any reason this might be?
You would see it if you are in the Landing Page editor in the form module, not in the Form Editor itself. If you are in the Landing Page editor and don’t see it, let me know
Yes I tried this . I checked form editor, landing page editor, and also in the template editor
do I need some kind of extended permissons to see this?
You shouldn’t, what level portal do you have?
This article might help <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/create-smart-forms>
admin, contact, marketing are under my preferences
Yes i have been through this and a few others but I don't have the option on any modules, not just this one
hmm, can you DM me a link to the page editor you are trying to add smart content too
I sent it I thik (sorry not100% sure this what you are looking for new to HubSpot)
For those following along at home, the issue was the page was using a custom module instead of the native forms module
template level smart content?
<@U38EZFVFE> it is something you can do, but still only on rich text or form modules
Just saw this now, but yes we have and it does translate the button text

For anyone using the "Publish with custom short links" <http://bit.ly|bit.ly> integration in social messaging, have you seen your custom branded domain flip back to <http://bit.ly|bit.ly> links for no reason? Can't figure out if the disconnect is HS side of things talking to <http://bit.ly|bit.ly> or bit.ly...
